head.supplied: 19/2/83. ¶ ¶ Some time ago, dear Prof. Tate, I had made some notes on the curious little Composite, which you collected on 2 Oct. 1880 near Wellington, ¶ and of which you sent me a specimen some mon...

div.p: Barr Smith Library, University of Adelaide, SA.

Some time ago, dear Prof. Tate, I had made some notes on the curious little Composite, which you collected on 2 Oct. 1880 near Wellington,
SA. and of which you sent me a specimen some months ago. Only now I have in connection with other work on allied plants completed the elaboration. It is pleasing to me, that thus I can furnish again some slight contribution to the publication of the R. S.
Royal Society.
of S.A., and pay you some homage at the same time.
M described Epaltes tatei in B83.12.03, p. 31, in the part of the paper read to the Royal Society of SA on 6 March 1883. I look forward with great interest to you
your. essay on the Kang. Isl. Flora. The notes, which you wished, were furnished some days ago, concerning former collectors there.
Kangaroo Island, SA. Tate (1883), pp. 131-5 is an account of the botanical exploration of the island. M to R Tate, 13 February 1883 (in this edition as 83-02-13b), contains notes on early collecting.

The Universal Census
B83.03.04. is now ready, the index having gone through the press, but the copies have yet to be bound; so some little delay will still arise, before any can go out complete.
